title: Nikon scope pictures annotation & data collection

yaml.title: Nikon scope pictures annotation & data collection
yaml.subtitle: Annotating images of embryonic development of Montipora capitata rice corals exposed to PVC leachate
yaml.author: Sarah Tanja

markdown.markdown:
This guide is meant to be a checklist for annotating categories of embryonic development in *Montipora capitata* using NIS-Elements BR.

For a basic introduction to using NIS Elements Annotation & Measurement tool, check out [this elearning video](https://www.microscope.healthcare.nikon.com/resources/e-learning/annotations-and-measurements).

1.  Open NIS-Elements BR

2.  File\>Open...

3.  Select sample folder

4.  Open `*stitch*.nd2`

5.  Show scale\> Burn scale...

    1.  Select `No` in response to pop-up asking to convert to RGB

6.  Select `Appending Labels` and click ont he three dots to change font color to white and background to transparent. Keep all other settings the same.

    ![](labeltext.png)

7.  Using the annotation & measurement tool, insert text to label via numbering 1-n each embryo at its upper left quadrant. Do not number debris.

8.  Click on the taxonomy shape icon under `Count & Taxonomy`

9.  Right click inside the table to access `Taxonomy Options`

10. Set number of classes to 10

    1.  egg

    2.  cleavage

    3.  4 to 16 cell

    4.  32 to 64 cell

    5.  prawn chip

    6.  early gastrula

    7.  debris

    8.  malformed

    9.  typical

    10. torn

        ![](taxonomy.png)

11. Click on taxonomy label and label each embryo with a selection from phase (egg, cleavage, 4-16, 32-64, prawn chip, or early gastrula) and proper selection from status (debris, malformed, typical, torn)

12. File \> Save

    1.  This saves the annotation layer to the .nd2 file

13. File \> Save As ... \> JPEG - JIFF Format (\*.jpg*; \**.jpeg)

    1.  Filename `_scale` replaces `_00`

        ![](scale.png)

14. Close jpg, make sure you're working on the nd2 file with annotations showing

15. Save again as JPG with `Burn Annotations` checked, and `anno` to replace `scale`

16. Reopen .nd2 file with annotations showing

17. Fill out Google sheet for each stitched sample slide

markdown.srcMarkdownNoYaml:
# Annotation checklist

This guide is meant to be a checklist for annotating categories of embryonic development in *Montipora capitata* using NIS-Elements BR.

For a basic introduction to using NIS Elements Annotation & Measurement tool, check out [this elearning video](https://www.microscope.healthcare.nikon.com/resources/e-learning/annotations-and-measurements).

1.  Open NIS-Elements BR

2.  File\>Open...

3.  Select sample folder

4.  Open `*stitch*.nd2`

5.  Show scale\> Burn scale...

    1.  Select `No` in response to pop-up asking to convert to RGB

6.  Select `Appending Labels` and click ont he three dots to change font color to white and background to transparent. Keep all other settings the same.

    ![](labeltext.png)

7.  Using the annotation & measurement tool, insert text to label via numbering 1-n each embryo at its upper left quadrant. Do not number debris.

8.  Click on the taxonomy shape icon under `Count & Taxonomy`

9.  Right click inside the table to access `Taxonomy Options`

10. Set number of classes to 10

    1.  egg

    2.  cleavage

    3.  4 to 16 cell

    4.  32 to 64 cell

    5.  prawn chip

    6.  early gastrula

    7.  debris

    8.  malformed

    9.  typical

    10. torn

        ![](taxonomy.png)

11. Click on taxonomy label and label each embryo with a selection from phase (egg, cleavage, 4-16, 32-64, prawn chip, or early gastrula) and proper selection from status (debris, malformed, typical, torn)

12. File \> Save

    1.  This saves the annotation layer to the .nd2 file

13. File \> Save As ... \> JPEG - JIFF Format (\*.jpg*; \**.jpeg)

    1.  Filename `_scale` replaces `_00`

        ![](scale.png)

14. Close jpg, make sure you're working on the nd2 file with annotations showing

15. Save again as JPG with `Burn Annotations` checked, and `anno` to replace `scale`

16. Reopen .nd2 file with annotations showing

17. Fill out Google sheet for each stitched sample slide
